value.title: Vernon Jones, a Pro-Trump Republican, Will Challenge Kemp in Georgia
value.excerpt: Vernon Jones, a Democrat-turned Republican and onetime state representative who has called Georgia’s presidential election “fixed,” will oppose Gov. Brian Kemp, one of Donald Trump’s top targets.

value.title: Pence underwent successful surgery to have a pacemaker implanted
value.excerpt: Former Vice President Mike Pence underwent a successful surgery Wednesday to have a pacemaker implanted to help combat a slow heart rate he's recently experienced, his office said in a statement.

value.title: Biden imposes new sanctions on Russia in response to election interference and cyber hacks
value.excerpt: The Biden administration is expected to announce sanctions as soon as Thursday targeting Russian individuals and entities, in addition to the expulsion of as many as a dozen Russian diplomats from the US in response to the hack of SolarWinds and election interference, according to two sources familiar

value.title: Biden tells family of 'hero' Capitol Police officer killed in car attack: 'He’s in your blood'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden eulogized fallen Capitol Police Officer William “Billy” Evans at a memorial service in the Capitol Rotunda on Tuesday, reflecting on his own personal tragedies as he sought to comfort Evans’ surviving wife and children.

value.title: Obama praises Biden's 'bold leadership' on Afghanistan withdrawal
value.excerpt: Former President Barack Obama on Wednesday praised President Joe Biden's "bold leadership" for his decision to withdraw all US troops from Afghanistan by September 11, saying that "it is time to recognize that we have accomplished all that we can militarily" in America's longest war.

value.title: Biden says parts of US are 'backsliding into the days of Jim Crow'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden said Wednesday that parts of the United States are "backsliding into the days of Jim Crow" by passing laws he says are reminiscent of when Black Americans had to pay poll taxes and pass other tests before casting their vote.

value.title: Can this Latina law professor tapped by Biden help reform the Supreme Court?
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order creating a presidential commission to study whether the Supreme Court should be overhauled, and he has named Yale Law School professor Cristina M. Rodríguez as its co-chair. Rodríguez and Bob Bauer ...

value.title: First lady Jill Biden to undergo 'procedure,' White House says
value.excerpt: The White House says President Joe Biden will accompany his wife, Jill Biden, early Wednesday morning to an appointment where she will undergo a “common medical procedure.” The White House says both Bidens will then return to the White House and “resume their normal schedule.

value.title: Biden's risky decision to end America's longest war gives him a chance to refocus US foreign policy
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden's decision to pull US troops out of Afghanistan by September marks a pivotal moment after almost 20 years of war in the country and thousands of lives lost -- it also signals a coming shift in US focus and resources overseas.

value.title: Biden proposes meeting with Putin amid rising Ukraine tensions
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday and proposed a meeting in a third country in the coming months as tensions between Russia and Ukraine rise in eastern Europe.

value.title: Analysis: Michigan vaccine rebuff puts Biden and a top ally in a dicey political spot
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden is confronting his most controversial and politically unpalatable moment yet since assuming responsibility for the US' response to the pandemic.

value.title: Nikki Haley says she'll support and not challenge Trump if he runs in 2024
value.excerpt: Former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley on Monday said she would back her onetime boss, former President Donald Trump, if he decides to run for the Republican Party's presidential nomination again in 2024 and not mount a bid against him.

value.title: Biden calls for 'peace and calm' in the wake of Daunte Wright's fatal encounter with police in Minnesota
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Monday called for "peace and calm" in the wake of Daunte Wright's fatal encounter with police in Minnesota, saying his death does not justify violence or looting.

value.title: Trump State Department appointee facing Capitol riot charges ordered released from jail
value.excerpt: A Trump State Department official who was charged in the Capitol insurrection will be released from jail, a federal judge said Monday, overturning a previous ruling that the man was too dangerous to release.

value.title: Subpoenaing the Brookings Institution, Durham Focuses on Trump-Russia Dossier
value.excerpt: Greg Kahn for The New York Times By Charlie Savage and Adam Goldman WASHINGTON — Exiled from Twitter, former President Donald J. Trump issued a sarcastic statement recently inquiring about the ongoing public silence from John H. Durham, the special ...

value.title: Biden keeping Trump's pick for Moscow ambassador in place
value.excerpt: The Biden administration recently decided to keep the Trump-appointed US ambassador on the job in Moscow for the foreseeable future, two senior administration officials told CNN, demonstrating a willingness to nurture areas of stability in the US-Russia relationship after it got off to a tumultuous start.

value.title: Old Trump health team rivalries resurface in Texas House race
value.excerpt: A senior Trump health official’s bid to become the first administration alumnus elected to Congress is running into resistance from an unlikely source: his own former colleagues. Brian Harrison, a chief of staff to former Health and Human Services ...

value.title: Arkansas' GOP governor says Trump's attacks on party leaders are 'divisive' and 'not helpful'
value.excerpt: Arkansas' Republican governor on Sunday knocked former President Donald Trump's recent attacks on top party leaders as "divisive" and unhelpful for elected GOP officials around the country.

value.title: U.S. warns Iran it won’t lift all Trump-era sanctions to return to nuclear deal
value.excerpt: The Biden administration warned Friday that it will not lift every single economic sanction that former President Donald Trump imposed on Iran, despite pressure from Iran to do so as the two countries try to resurrect a nearly dead nuclear agreement.

value.title: Trump repeats election lies and insults McConnell in front of RNC donors in Palm Beach
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump repeated familiar lies about the 2020 election and insulted Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell Saturday when speaking to Republican National Committee donors gathered for the first time since Trump's defeat, a person in the room told CNN.

value.title: Matt Gaetz shows Donald Trump's defiant style is here to stay
value.excerpt: In a fiery defense of his reputation Friday night, embattled Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz showed how former President Donald Trump's brash, defiant politics now serve as the template for survival for the most unwelcome figures in a Republican Party that's out of power in Washington and desperately trying

value.title: Trump appointee 'bragged' about influencing CDC reports on Covid-19, House committee says
value.excerpt: A former Trump administration appointee privately boasted last year about influencing Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's scientific reports about Covid-19 and attacked the agency's guidance while advocating for a herd immunity strategy, according to a House select committee investigating the

value.title: GOP race against Cuomo kicks off with Trump allies — Staffers dispute book work was voluntary — New rules aim to reduce school closures
value.excerpt: Not to let a news vacuum go to waste, two staunch allies of former President Donald Trump are kicking off conversations about New York’s 2022 gubernatorial race in earnest. Reactions? Well, a Republican hasn’t won a statewide race in New York since ...

value.title: Joe Manchin on the fate of Joe Biden's agenda
value.excerpt: Joe Manchin says it's no fun being the most powerful man in Washington.

value.title: Mueller fraud investigator brought in to help Vance's probe of Trump Org.
value.excerpt: A former FBI agent key to special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 presidential election is one of several forensic accountants working on the Manhattan district attorney's investigation into the Trump Organization, people familiar with the matter say.

value.title: EPA replaces Trump-era chemical guidance, calling it 'compromised' by politics
value.excerpt: The Biden-led Environmental Protection Agency says Trump administration political officials "compromised" an assessment of chemical dangers and has replaced it with a new one they say "upholds the tenants of scientific integrity."

value.title: GOP group tells online donors: Give every month or 'we will have to tell Trump you're a DEFECTOR'
value.excerpt: The campaign arm of House Republicans is using an aggressive tactic to push online donors toward committing to monthly contributions, telling them that opting out of having the same amount automatically charged to their credit card or withdrawn from their bank each month is an act of disloyalty toward

value.title: Caitlyn Jenner getting advice from ex-Trump campaign manager Parscale on possible California governor bid
value.excerpt: Caitlyn Jenner is getting advice from former Trump campaign manager Brad Parscale on how to set up a potential California gubernatorial bid, according to a source familiar with the discussions.

value.title: Biden to take first limited steps on gun control, including on 'ghost guns' and pistol braces
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden plans to announce new executive actions on guns on Thursday, a person familiar with the plans said, fulfilling a commitment he made in the aftermath of two deadly shootings last month.

value.title: Boehner lays blame for 'that bloody insurrection' at Trump's feet
value.excerpt: Former House Speaker John Boehner said former President Donald Trump "incited that bloody insurrection" at the US Capitol and blamed his false election claims for the GOP losing control of Congress, according to excerpts from his forthcoming book obtained by The New York Times.
